div.p: MS papers 37, folder 211, no. 602, Haast family papers, Alexander Turnbull Library, Wellington.

It is very pleasing to me, dear Doctor von Haast, to recommend to your friendly consideration the celebrated Dr Beccari, renowned for his itinerations in New Guinea, Sumatra & Borneo. As Director of the Christchurch Museum you have in Dr Beccari a Colleague, as he succeeds the late Prof Parlatore in the Directorship at Florence.
I feel convinced, that your meeting this distinguished Gentleman personally, will lead to extensive arrangements for interchanges between his and your institution.
